page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: POPULATION:A small village of approximately 1500 working/middle class people in a rural setting.ANTIQUARIES:Some of its old property(18th.C.)and ancient cross and unique 5 holed stocks suggest it was a thriving township centuries before the manufacturing town of Widnes sprang into existance.Named Grohinton in the Norman,Testa de Nevill.20th.CENTURY DEVELOPMENT:Most of the modern development occured after 39/45 war and many of its present residents originate from the Liverpool area.STUDY AREA:The study is centred on Cronton village,which is in the Metropolitan Borough of Knowsley, Merseyside.The postal area is Widnes, Cheshire.The amenities count covers the whole block.
